intro: Popowia ramosissima, commonly known as the branching popowia, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a hairy calyx. Popowia ramosissima is often found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded or semi-shaded conditions.
